intro: Tephrosia lepida subsp. lepida, commonly known as the narrowleaf tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its small, white to yellowish flowers are clustered in racemes, and it produces slender, hairy pods containing several seeds. This species is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to dry, tropical climates.
